introduction: In this video, we'll explore how to build a job board app that can be used as a real startup. We'll start with a minimum viable product (MVP) that pulls data from a single job board API and displays it in a simple front end. We'll use React and Material UI for the front end, an Express server for the backend, Redis for data storage, and a node cron job to fetch and refresh job data at regular intervals.

sections.title: Section 1: Setting Up the Project
content: Creating a package.json file with necessary dependencies
Installing Cron as a dependency
Configuring the domain name and API routes
Deploying the app to a server

sections.title: Section 2: Data Fetching and Storage
content: Pulling job data from the API using Express
Storing job data in Redis
Fetching and displaying job data in the front end
Implementing a node cron job to refresh job data

sections.title: Section 3: Front End Development
content: Designing a simple front end with React and Material UI
Displaying job listings and job details
Implementing filtering and sorting functionality
Integrating job board APIs

sections.title: Section 4: Algorithm Development
content: Developing an algorithm to filter job listings based on experience level
Implementing error handling and robustness
Improving filtering and sorting functionality
Adding monitoring and logging features

sections.title: Section 5: Final Touches and Deployment
content: Testing and debugging the app
Deploying the app to a production server
Configuring SSL/TLS certificates
Monitoring and maintaining the app
